title: Leadership Practical Competency Enhancement: Game Theory-Based Peer Learning Collaboration Strategy Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational grasp of game theory and collaborative learning experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: The prisoner's dilemma model from game theory can be applied to peer learning environments
Design strategies to enhance learning outcomes through collaborative strategy simulations
Utilize peer assessment and feedback systems on digital platforms at over 80% adoption

Learners analyze LMS-collected data (attendance, assessment scores, activity logs, etc.) to identify three factors contributing to low individual participation, propose at least two customized strategies (e.g., additional resources, mentoring connections, schedule adjustments), and achieve participation metrics (15% attendance improvement, 20% increase in assessment completion rate) within three months.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
